name: Pacific Gas & Electric Company PG&E
description: Pacific Gas & Electric Company PG&E is a utility company that provides natural gas and electricity to most of the northern two-thirds of California, including the San Francisco Bay Area.
emergency_steps:
1. Call 9-1-1 immediately if you encounter a downed power line and report its location.  
2. After contacting emergency services, call PG&E at 1-800-743-5000 to report the issue.  
3. Do not touch anyone or anything in contact with a downed power line.  
4. Keep children and pets away from fallen electric wires.  
5. Stay away from flooded areas and downed trees during and after a storm as these could be hiding an energized power line pgealerts.alerts.pge.com.

Non-Emergency Tips:  
1. Use the PG&E Report It app to report non-emergency safety concerns such as trees or vegetation near powerlines and problems with PG&E equipment pge.com.  
2. Prepare for potential power outages by having a plan in place and keeping emergency supplies on hand pge.com.
